conversation.text: You make the spring roll into a diamond shape.
I did that.  What is the next step now?
Are you using rice paper for your spring rolls?
Yes, I am using the traditional spring rolls.
Now put the roles in hot water for fifteen seconds.
evidence: place it in hot water for fifteen seconds

conversation.text: Done!  What do I do now?
What shape does your roll look like?
evidence: that it is in the shape of a diamond, not a square

conversation.text: It looks like a diamond.
Now add your filling to the roll.  Leave some a few inches of space in each corner.
I have three inches of space in each corner.  Is that good?
Yes, how thick is the filling in the middle?
evidence: an inch (2.5 cm) or so at most

conversation.text: It is only about half an inch thick.
On the bottom diamond, fold that inwards over the filling.
evidence: Fold the bottom corner over the filling.

conversation.text: Okay.  How do I keep folding after that?
Take the left quarter and fold it into the middle of the roll.
evidence: Fold the left corner into the middle of the roll

conversation.text: The edges of the wrap keep slipping up inside the wrap.
You can tuck the roll edges under the filling.  That should help you.
evidence: Consider tucking or rolling the bottom corner over the filling

conversation.text: That was a major help.  The wrap is a lot easier to handle now.
Take the right corner and fold it so that it meets the left corner on top of the filling.
evidence: Fold the right corner into the middle of the roll, to meet the left.

conversation.text: The two edges are touching now over the filling.  What is next?
Take the bottom of the roll and roll it upwards until you get to the top.
evidence: Now, just roll from the bottom upwards until you've fully folded the spring roll

conversation.text: It looks delicious!  What do we do next?
Start eating your tasty meal!
Thanks for your help!
Congratulations! You have successfully completed this cooking task.
Can you teach me to fold a spring roll?

recipe.title: How to Fold a Spring Roll

procedure.summary: Place your spring roll on a plate in the shape of a diamond.
procedure.description: If you use rice paper, which is traditionally used in many spring rolls, then you should read the instructions on how to prepare it. You may have to place it in hot water for fifteen seconds to get it ready. Each of the four corners should be pointing out, so that it is in the shape of a diamond, not a square. Keep in mind that, unlike the first method, you can't use egg paste to help the roll stick together because this roll is already cooked. You don't want to put raw egg on it if you don't plan on cooking it.

procedure.summary: Put the filling in the lower center of the spring roll, horizontally.
procedure.description: Now, scoop in the filling so it lies horizontally from left to right, with at least 2 inches (5 cm) of space between the filling and the left and right corners. This will keep the filling from coming out the sides. It shouldn't be put in too high -- just an inch (2.5 cm) or so at most -- so that you have plenty of space to fold the roll over the filling.

procedure.summary: Fold the bottom corner over the filling.
procedure.description: Now, pick up the bottom corner and fold it over the filling, so the bottom corner is now facing the same direction as the top corner. About an inch (2.5 cm) or so of the corner should be folded above the filling, so that there's still a good 2-3 inches (5 - 7.5 cm) between the bottom corner and the top corner.

procedure.summary: Consider tucking or rolling the bottom corner over the filling (optional).
procedure.description: Some people like to tuck the top corner into the filling, so it disappears into the ingredients. Some like to even roll it over the ingredients one full rotation, to secure them there. Others prefer to go the traditional route and to keep the corner folded up -- it's your call.

procedure.summary: Fold the left corner into the middle of the roll.
procedure.description: Fold the corner over, so it points in the opposite direction, in the middle of the roll. It should begin to resemble an envelope.

procedure.summary: Fold the right corner into the middle of the roll, to meet the left.
procedure.description: Now, just do what you did on the right side of the roll. The left and right corners should just touch. Now, you've almost finished making your envelope. Right now, it should look like an envelope with the filling inside and the flap facing up.

procedure.summary: Roll the bottom up until you've finished folding the spring roll.
procedure.description: Now, just roll from the bottom upwards until you've fully folded the spring roll using the envelope method. Now, all you have to do is sit back and enjoy your delicious treat.
